{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3547704,"name":"Luca Carvalho","username":"CarvalhoJeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carvalhojeo/{size}/249007_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T23:21:37.693Z","cooked":"

Our team has been experiencing some issues related to the NT4 disconnecting.

Basically, every NT4 client (AdvantageScope, Limelights, PhotonVision, our keyboard reader code) keeps disconnecting and reconnecting over and over.

The issue is super inconsistent—sometimes everything runs fine for hours, and other times it happens a lot.

Here is some notable errors/warnings from the console:

image896×84 4.15 KB

image1009×83 29.8 KB

Here are some thoughts that we would think that could be the problem

  1. High RoboRIO CPU usage. It doesn’t throw any errors, and the robot works fine, I would find it hard to be this because of the inconsistent times that the error is given with the same code, (sometimes the error never happens for hours)
  2. Radio overheating. When we take a break and put fans on the radios (the robot radio and the access point), the disconnects stop. But after a while, they come back, and we get stuck in this cycle where we think we’ve fixed it, but it just happens again.

Here is a DSLog of one of the times that the error ocurred

drive.google.com

2025_03_04 19_20_41 ter.dslog

Google Drive file.

We were wondering if anyone else has had this problem before and if there’s something we might be doing wrong. Any ideas or advice would be super helpful

Someone else has reported a similar issue recently, but we’ve not been able to reproduce it or collect more data quite yet.

What would help at least initially is some wireshark captures of it happening.

github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib

Observed NT4 rapid connect/disconnect cycles during competition match

opened 01:12AM - 03 Mar 25 UTC
chauser
type: bug

**Describe the bug** I helped a team this weekend that could get no dashboard di…splayed on-field during competition but it worked fine in the pits. Eventually looked at the wpilog and found what is shown in the attachment: the server repeatedly logs a shuffleboard connection followed 1/2 second later by a disconnection and then another connection a half second after that. This continued from before the match until it was over. Shuffledboard on the driverstation never showed that it was connected. The team reported that they had no luck with Elastic or SmartDashboard either. ![](https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T99Q4Q1PE-F08FK9A15PF/image.png) A second team reported similar inability to get their dashboard to connect but I do not have a wpilog for them. I learned that both teams were showing driver camera streams on their driverstation computers without any attempt to control the camera stream bandwidth. Both teams stated they could do without the camera streams and turned them off. They had no further problems with dashboard connection throughout the competition. My best guess is that the on-field bandwidth limiting is triggering this behavior but I don't know enough about how either the bandwidth limiting works or how NT4 decides that a connection isn't viable (and therefore ends it) to be sure this is the reason. I don't have an adequate model that would explain how bandwidth-limiting would lead to this particular behavior of NT, but so far it is the only scenario I've managed to posit that matches the observations. It would be helpful for CSAs to know if on-field bandwidth limiting is the cause of this behavior or if there is some other root cause that we should be looking for. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7f6f39f5-b9f7-4e3f-a9fe-ea1f5728b7c4)

The problem I am experiencing is even worse because it’s not just the dashboard that keeps connecting and disconnecting from the robot, it’s all of our NetworkTables connections.

Maybe that’s a general connection issue; do you see a stable connection in the Driver Station/in a ping test?
Do you have the latest WPI version installed on the computer and in the code?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T03:46:14.092Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494255,"topic_slug":"nt4-disconnecting-randomly","display_username":"Yishai Levy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49147,"username":"CarvalhoJeo","name":"Luca Carvalho","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carvalhojeo/{size}/249007_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57809,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator"},"post_url":"/t/nt4-disconnecting-randomly/494255/7","custom_user_title":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3547939,"name":"Luca Carvalho","username":"CarvalhoJeo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carvalhojeo/{size}/249007_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T03:51:30.242Z","cooked":"

Yes, we do see a stable connection, 0 messages warning us about a disconnection or something similar.

The only worrying message that we see is the one in the first post.

levyishai:

Do you have the latest WPI version installed on the computer and in the code?

Yes, we do, 2025.3.1

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T03:51:30.242Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494255,"topic_slug":"nt4-disconnecting-randomly","display_username":"Luca Carvalho","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1156"},"post_url":"/t/nt4-disconnecting-randomly/494255/8","custom_user_title":"1156","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3547998,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T05:00:39.931Z","cooked":"

We see this issue as well, but only with our limelights. This only happens shortly after code startup when our loop timings are awful and all over the place. Setting the main thread to higher/realtime priority makes this issue very common, so maybe that can help reproduce. We alleviated it a bit by waiting 20s after code starts to set our thread priority, but it still happens often.

This is the exact line we use to set our priority:

Threads.setCurrentThreadPriority(true, 10)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T05:00:39.931Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494255,"topic_slug":"nt4-disconnecting-randomly","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/nt4-disconnecting-randomly/494255/9","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548000,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T05:05:51.924Z","cooked":"

That is probably unrelated. If you starve the NetworkTables server thread by using up all the CPU with a real-time priority thread, you will definitely get disconnects, because it simply can’t respond in a timely manner to client pings, especially if it’s also busy processing other data that you’re giving it. The NT server thread runs without real time priority.

The random disconnects issue being described by others sounds more like a network related issue.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T05:07:41.102Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494255,"topic_slug":"nt4-disconnecting-randomly","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33850,"username":"mjansen4857","name":"Michael Jansen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/nt4-disconnecting-randomly/494255/10","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548011,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T05:33:29.063Z","cooked":"

Our loop times are typically <8ms, so I don’t believe we’re using up all the CPU. DS reported cpu usage is usually slightly below 90%. The disconnects still happen while the thread isn’t set to real time priority yet. Everything also typically works fine with the higher priority. It will just fail to connect a bunch of times, but when it finally succeeds it will stay connected without issue for as long as we leave code running. This issue definitely happened for us before we set a higher thread priority at all, setting it higher just made it more common. Also, nothing else has any issues during these disconnects. Dashboards, advantagescope, glass, etc connect fine and keep receiving continuous data from the server. Only our limelights have this connection failure loop. They are still networked fine, and we can access their web dashboards/stream the camera uninterrupted. Just the NT connection has issues. It’s not just failing to connect or randomly disconnecting either, it’s connecting to the server, then immediately being disconnected.

Idk if this is a limelight problem or not, but our symptoms sound very similar to what some others have described, so thought I’d chime in.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T05:33:29.063Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494255,"topic_slug":"nt4-disconnecting-randomly","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/nt4-disconnecting-randomly/494255/11","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548301,"name":"Carl Hauser","username":"chauser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a587f6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T16:19:21.170Z","cooked":"

@mjansen4857 and @CarvalhoJeo, if you have logs from on-robot logging to share that would potentially be useful (the logged console contains the NT server’s perspective on what is happening).

At first glance both of these appear different from the log I observed and posted in the WPILib issue linked above.

Details about how your robots are networked might also help. In particular how are the limelights networked with the Rio? What is in the network path between the DS and the robot? Which firmware are you running on the robot and access point radios (if you’re using an access point)?

And I second the request for wireshark logs if you can obtain them. Those would be very useful.

Have there been any significant changes in NetworkTables, be it protocol versions or differences with structs/etc. since 2025.1.1? I’ve seen issues like these before occur when mixing wildly different protocol versions, e.g. 2023 with 2024.

I looked a bit at your wpilog. One thing I noticed is you have a client, identifying itself as “DartClient” on 10.11.56.21 (not shown on your diagram) that appears to be making multiple simultaneous NT4 connections. That is at least odd. But the first of those only occurs 3 seconds after the first disconnection at 87.073 seconds by the photonvision device. But that’s in itself odd because there is no prior connection message for that device.

Whatever that program is, if it produces any local messages on the computer where it is running, those may be helpful.

I also see quite a few loop overrruns so maybe what you’re seeing is akin to what @mjansen4857 is seeing.

chauser:

“DartClient” on 10.11.56.21 (not shown on your diagram)

That may be the Elastic Dashboard that I had open and forgot to put in the diagram, sorry about that, but the problem still had occurred without it opened.

chauser:

But that’s in itself odd because there is no prior connection message for that device.

Do you mean the Photonvision?

chauser:

I also see quite a few loop overrruns so maybe what you’re seeing is akin to what @mjansen4857 is seeing.

It may be, our RoboRIO is constantly above 90% of CPU usage during TeleOp, I just find it odd that sometimes we run the robot for hours without the error

No, there have been no NT changes so far in 2025 (since 2025.1.1). There were fairly significant changes between 2024 and 2025.1.1 that should have helped with disconnect behavior under heavy load, but it’s possible there’s an incorrect edge case in that new code that is being hit under poor network conditions.

CarvalhoJeo:

That may be the Elastic Dashboard

Elastic’s client name is “Elastic” (or “elastic” if it’s before beta 4). I believe PathPlanner’s client name starts with “DartClient”. However Elastic and PathPlanner have extremely similar client implementations since Elastic’s is built off of PathPlanner’s

In the GitHub issue, Carl noted that Elastic supposedly had two connections open. It’s possible that’s what’s being seen.

(edit: it’s an RTT client so it’s not that)
